meanings.sent1: She had to recopy the letter because of a mistake.
meanings.sent2: I will recopy the notes to make them clearer.
meanings.sent3: Recopying the document felt like redoing a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: His mind kept recopying the image, trying to understand it better.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to recopy the assignment neatly.

meanings.definition: The act of making a copy of something again
meanings.sent1: The recopying of the report was necessary for accuracy.
meanings.sent2: I found the recopying of the document to be tedious.
meanings.sent3: The recopying of the recipe made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The recopying of the map revealed new details.
meanings.sent5: Her recopying of the poem showed her attention to detail.
